detaileddescription.para: Malloc macro.

memberdef.name: DBG_MSG
memberdef.initializer: do { \ int rank; \ MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD,&rank); \ if ( rank == RANK ) \ printf( "%s:%d[DEBUG-%d] " MSG "\n", __FILENAME__,__LINE__,rank, ##__VA_ARGS__); \ if ( RANK == -1 ) \ printf( "%s:%d[DEBUG-%d] " MSG "\n", __FILENAME__,__LINE__,rank, ##__VA_ARGS__); \ } while (0)

detaileddescription.para: MD5-hash: unsigned char digest length.
MD5-hash: hex converted char digest length.

for ptr manipulation
void ptr type
The member fh is a generic file handle container large enough to hold any file handle type of I/O modes that are used within FTI.
(For FTI-FF only) Keeps information about the file. 'checksum' is the hash of the file excluding the file meta data. 'myHash' is the hash of the file meta data.

Holds information for each data block relevant for the dCP mechanism. This structure is a member of FTIFF_dbvar. It is stored as an array with n elements, where n corresponds to the number of data blocks in that the data chunk is partitioned (depending on the dCP block size).

briefdescription.para: Information about protected variable in datablock.

detaileddescription.para: (For FTI-FF only) Keeps information about the chunk of the protected variable with id stored in the current datablock. 'idx' is the index for the array element of 'FTIT_dataset* FTI_Data', that contains variable with 'id'.
(For FTI-FF only) Keeps information about the current datablock in file

The request pointer is void in order to allow the structure to keep the head rank staging info if used by a head process or the application rank staging info otherwise. The cast is performed via the macros 'FTI_SI_HPTR( ptr )' for the head processes and 'FTI_SI_APTR( ptr )' for the application processes.

briefdescription.para: Double mapped as two integers to allow bit-wise operations.

detaileddescription.para: Double mapped as integer and byte array to allow bit-wise operators so that we can inject failures on it.

briefdescription.para: Float mapped as integer to allow bit-wise operations.

detaileddescription.para: Float mapped as integer and byte array to allow bit-wise operators so that we can inject failures on it.

briefdescription.para: Type that consists of other FTI types.

detaileddescription.para: This type allows creating complex datatypes.
This type allows handling data structures.

briefdescription.para: Holds info about field in complex type.

detaileddescription.para: This type simplify creating complex datatypes.
This type stores the metadata related with a dataset.
This type stores all the metadata necessary for the restart.
This type stores the general configuration metadata.
This type stores the topology metadata.
This type stores all the checkpoint metadata.

briefdescription.para: Type to describe failure injections in FTI.

detaileddescription.para: This type allows users to describe a SDC failure injection model.
This type stores all the dynamic metadata related to the current execution

briefdescription.para: Pointer to functions which are used to write the checkpoint file.

detaileddescription.para: This is a general description of what different file formats need to implement in order to checkpoint.
